t: Mark 9
The Transfiguration

And*p Jesus was saying to them, “Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r there*r are*r some*r of*r those*r who*r are*r standing*r here*r who*r will*r not*r taste*r death*r until*r they*r see*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r after*r it*r has*r come*r with*r power.”*r
Six*p days later, Jesus took with Him Peter and James and John, and brought them up on a high mountain by themselves. And He was transfigured before them;
and His garments became radiant and exceedingly white, as no launderer on earth can whiten them.
Elijah appeared to them along with Moses; and they were talking with Jesus.
Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here; let us make three tabernacles, one for You, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
For he did not know what to answer; for they became terrified.
Then a cloud formed, overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud, “This is My beloved Son, listen to Him!”
All at once they looked around and saw no one with them anymore, except Jesus alone.
As*p they were coming down from the mountain, He gave them orders not to relate to anyone what they had seen, until the Son of Man rose from the dead.
They seized upon that statement, discussing with one another what rising from the dead meant.
They asked Him, saying, “Why*i is*i it*i that the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

And He said to them, “Elijah*r does*r first*r come*r and*r restore*r all*r things.*r And*r yet*ir how*r is*r it*r written*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r that*r He*r will*r suffer*r many*r things*r and*r be*r treated*r with*r contempt?*r
But*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r Elijah*r has*r indeed*r come,*r and*r they*r did*r to*r him*r whatever*r they*r wished,*r just*r as*r it*r is*r written*r of*r him.”*r
All Things Possible
When*p they came back*i to the disciples, they saw a large crowd around them, and some*i scribes arguing with them.

and whenever it seizes him, it slams him to*i the*i ground*i and he foams at*i the*i mouth,*i and grinds his teeth and stiffens out. I told Your disciples to cast it out, and they could not do*i it.”*i
And He answered them and said, “O*r unbelieving*r generation,*r how*r long*r shall*r I*r be*r with*r you?*r How*r long*r shall*r I*r put*r up*r with*r you?*r Bring*r him*r to*r Me!”*r
They brought the boy to Him. When he saw Him, immediately the spirit threw him into a convulsion, and falling to the ground, he began*i rolling around and foaming at*i the*i mouth.*i
And He asked his father, “How*r long*r has*r this*r been*r happening*r to*r him?”*r And he said, “From childhood.

Death and Resurrection Foretold
From*p there they went out and began*i to go through Galilee, and He did not want anyone to know about*i it.*i
